results:
Based on my search results, I can provide information about Polish science fiction community's perception of "Dune" as a foundational work of the genre:

"Dune" by Frank Herbert has been recognized in prestigious rankings of the best science fiction books, though it was defeated in at least one major ranking.

The Polish science fiction community regards "Dune" as fundamentally important to the genre:

The novel was honored with the first Nebula Award in 1965 and the Hugo Award in 1966. In 1987, in a reader poll by Locus magazine for the best science fiction novel of all time, it took 1st place.

"Dune" by Frank Herbert is described as "an epic tale of politics, religion and ecology on a desert planet, which draws the reader into a complex world full of intrigue and mysticism". The Dune series by Frank Herbert is considered "one of the most magnificent epics in the history of fantasy literature" and "was a response to The Lord of the Rings, but from the science fiction genre".

These books are considered "the best science fiction saga in the world". Dune is classified as a classic of the science fiction genre.

The work has had significant cultural impact: The Dune books had a huge impact on culture, inspiring many creators of novels, music, films, television programs and series, games and comics. We owe the existence of Star Wars to this series.

There is probably no person in the world who would not associate the title "Dune". It can be safely said that Frank Herbert's work has long since gained cult status, and successive generations of readers reach for the novel published in 1965.
